Target: Property owners (third-party owned rooftop and tower properties)
Reason: Page states SBA's Site Management division contracts with client property owners throughout North America to market and manage their rooftop and tower properties.
Evidence Text: "The Site Management division of SBA contracts with our client property owners throughout North America to market and manage their rooftop and tower properties"

Reason: Page says SBA markets properties directly to national wireless carriers and negotiates site license agreements with them; indicates ongoing business relationship with carriers as tenants/leasers.
Evidence Text: "Market your property directly to national wireless carriers"; "negotiate site license agreements with national wireless carriers"; "market and manage their rooftop and tower properties to wireless carriers"

Reason: About SBA page states SBA is a preferred partner for wireless service providers and describes leasing antenna space to wireless service providers under long-term contracts; also offers site development services to assist them in developing networks.
Evidence Text: "Our size, experience, capabilities and resources make SBA a preferred partner for wireless service providers both domestically and internationally."

Reason: Page notes telecom carriers build/densify networks via towers, antenna placements, DAS, and small cells—stated as exactly what SBA does, implying SBA supports carriers' network deployments.
Evidence Text: "Telecommunication carriers are increasing network capacity... by building out or densifying their networks through the implementation of cell towers, antenna placements on buildings and rooftops, DAS and small cells – this is exactly what we do at SBA"

Reason: Page explicitly states SBA works with property owners to develop and monetize the wireless infrastructure potential of their real estate assets.
Evidence Text: "In addition, SBA works with property owners to strategically develop and monetize the wireless infrastructure potential of their real estate assets."

Reason: Tower Operations page states SBA's Area Operations Directors work closely with outside engineering firms when structural upgrades are needed to accommodate new equipment on SBA towers.
Evidence Text: "Our Area Operations Directors work closely with our outside engineering firms and internal leasing personnel if structural upgrades are needed on an SBA tower to accommodate new equipment."

Reason: Tower Operations page says SBA monitors towers to comply with FAA lighting requirements and maintains a safety record regarding filings of notices with the FAA, indicating an ongoing regulatory/compliance relationship.
Evidence Text: "monitoring of more than 7,000 towers to comply with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) lighting requirements"; "maintained a 100 percent safety record in respect to our filings of notices with the FAA."

Evidence Text: "DAS enhances the signals of wireless carriers such as AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon."

Evidence Text: "DAS enhances the signals of wireless carriers such as AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon."
